page.title: 18THE NEYLAND RAILWAY (2)
page.content:
The station was opened in{August {1855}and was a great success.
The first passengers arrived from Ireland in 1856.But changes were to come,for the{Great Western Railway,}as it was now called, decided to build a port at Goodwick in North Pembrokeshire, in 1906. From then on Neyland declined in importance. It was estimated that 400 people left Neyland to live in Goodwick.
{ The last train left the station}on Sunday June 14th. 1964.
Now the line has disappeared and Brunel's Quay is part of the new {Westfield Marina.
